arxiv.title: LServe: Efficient Long-sequence LLM Serving with Unified Sparse Attention
arxiv.authors: Shang Yang, Junxian Guo, Haotian Tang, Qinghao Hu, Guangxuan Xiao, Jiaming Tang, Yujun Lin, Zhijian Liu, Yao Lu, Song Han
arxiv.abstract:
Large language models (LLMs) have shown remarkable potential in processing
long sequences, yet efficiently serving these long-context models remains
challenging due to the quadratic computational complexity of attention in the
prefilling stage and the large memory footprint of the KV cache in the de...

arxiv.title: Interpretable Text Embeddings and Text Similarity Explanation: A Primer
arxiv.authors: Juri Opitz, Lucas Möller, Andrianos Michail, Simon Clematide
arxiv.abstract:
Text embeddings and text embedding models are a backbone of many AI and NLP
systems, particularly those involving search. However, interpretability
challenges persist, especially in explaining obtained similarity scores, which
is crucial for applications requiring transparency. In this paper, we giv...

arxiv.title: Aligning LLMs to Ask Good Questions A Case Study in Clinical Reasoning
arxiv.authors: Shuyue Stella Li, Jimin Mun, Faeze Brahman, Jonathan S. Ilgen, Yulia Tsvetkov, Maarten Sap
arxiv.abstract:
Large language models (LLMs) often fail to ask effective questions under
uncertainty, making them unreliable in domains where proactive
information-gathering is essential for decisionmaking. We present ALFA, a
framework that improves LLM question-asking by (i) decomposing the notion of a
"good" ques...

arxiv.title: FR-Spec: Accelerating Large-Vocabulary Language Models via Frequency-Ranked Speculative Sampling
arxiv.authors: Weilin Zhao, Tengyu Pan, Xu Han, Yudi Zhang, Ao Sun, Yuxiang Huang, Kaihuo Zhang, Weilun Zhao, Yuxuan Li, Jianyong Wang, Zhiyuan Liu, Maosong Sun
arxiv.abstract:
Speculative sampling has emerged as an important technique for accelerating
the auto-regressive generation process of large language models (LLMs) by
utilizing a draft-then-verify mechanism to produce multiple tokens per forward
pass. While state-of-the-art speculative sampling methods use only a si...

arxiv.title: Prompt-to-Leaderboard
arxiv.authors: Evan Frick, Connor Chen, Joseph Tennyson, Tianle Li, Wei-Lin Chiang, Anastasios N. Angelopoulos, Ion Stoica
arxiv.abstract:
Large language model (LLM) evaluations typically rely on aggregated metrics
like accuracy or human preference, averaging across users and prompts. This
averaging obscures user- and prompt-specific variations in model performance.
To address this, we propose Prompt-to-Leaderboard (P2L), a method that...

arxiv.title: CLIPPER: Compression enables long-context synthetic data generation
arxiv.authors: Chau Minh Pham, Yapei Chang, Mohit Iyyer
arxiv.abstract:
LLM developers are increasingly reliant on synthetic data, but generating
high-quality data for complex long-context reasoning tasks remains challenging.
We introduce CLIPPER, a compression-based approach for generating synthetic
data tailored to narrative claim verification - a task that requires r...

arxiv.title: GATE: Graph-based Adaptive Tool Evolution Across Diverse Tasks
arxiv.authors: Jianwen Luo, Yiming Huang, Jinxiang Meng, Fangyu Lei, Shizhu He, Xiao Liu, Shanshan Jiang, Bin Dong, Jun Zhao, Kang Liu
arxiv.abstract:
Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown great promise in tool-making, yet
existing frameworks often struggle to efficiently construct reliable toolsets
and are limited to single-task settings. To address these challenges, we
propose GATE (Graph-based Adaptive Tool Evolution), an adaptive framework t...

arxiv.title: Scaling Text-Rich Image Understanding via Code-Guided Synthetic Multimodal Data Generation
arxiv.authors: Yue Yang, Ajay Patel, Matt Deitke, Tanmay Gupta, Luca Weihs, Andrew Head, Mark Yatskar, Chris Callison-Burch, Ranjay Krishna, Aniruddha Kembhavi, Christopher Clark
arxiv.abstract:
Reasoning about images with rich text, such as charts and documents, is a
critical application of vision-language models (VLMs). However, VLMs often
struggle in these domains due to the scarcity of diverse text-rich
vision-language data. To address this challenge, we present CoSyn, a framework
that ...

arxiv.title: Revealing and Mitigating Over-Attention in Knowledge Editing
arxiv.authors: Pinzheng Wang, Zecheng Tang, Keyan Zhou, Juntao Li, Qiaoming Zhu, Min Zhang
arxiv.abstract:
Large Language Models have demonstrated superior performance across a wide
range of tasks, but they still exhibit undesirable errors due to incorrect
knowledge learned from the training data. To avoid this, knowledge editing
methods emerged to precisely edit the specific model knowledge via efficien...

arxiv.title: Towards Economical Inference: Enabling DeepSeek's Multi-Head Latent Attention in Any Transformer-based LLMs
arxiv.authors: Tao Ji, Bin Guo, Yuanbin Wu, Qipeng Guo, Lixing Shen, Zhan Chen, Xipeng Qiu, Qi Zhang, Tao Gui
arxiv.abstract:
Multi-head Latent Attention (MLA) is an innovative architecture proposed by
DeepSeek, designed to ensure efficient and economical inference by
significantly compressing the Key-Value (KV) cache into a latent vector.
Compared to MLA, standard LLMs employing Multi-Head Attention (MHA) and its
variants...

papers_with_code.abstract: This paper reports the work of creating bilingual mappings in English for certain synsets of Hindi wordnet, the need for doing this, the methods adopted and the tools created for the task. papers_with_code.abstract: In this paper, we report on our experiments in building a summarization system for generating summaries from annual reports. papers_with_code.title: IndoWordNet::Similarity- Computing Semantic Similarity and Relatedness using IndoWordNet
papers_with_code.abstract: Semantic similarity and relatedness measures play an important role in natural language processing applications. papers_with_code.abstract: We present ReLCo— the Revita Learner Corpus—a new semi-automatically annotated learner corpus for Russian. papers_with_code.abstract: This paper describes the machine translation systems proposed by the University of Technology Sydney Natural Language Processing (UTS_NLP) team for the WMT20 English-Basque biomedical translation tasks. papers_with_code.abstract: This paper presents Gesture AMR, an extension to Abstract Meaning Representation (AMR), that captures the meaning of gesture. papers_with_code.abstract: The robustness of pretrained language models(PLMs) is generally measured using performance drops on two or more domains. papers_with_code.abstract: Obtaining linguistic annotation from novice crowdworkers is far from trivial. A case in point is the annotation of discourse relations, which is a complicated task. papers_with_code.abstract: In embodied cognition, physical experiences are believed to shape abstract cognition, such as natural language and reasoning. papers_with_code.title: Breeding Fillmore’s Chickens and Hatching the Eggs: Recombining Frames and Roles in Frame-Semantic Parsing
papers_with_code.abstract: Frame-semantic parsers traditionally predict predicates, frames, and semantic roles in a fixed order. This paper explores the ‘chicken-or-egg’ problem of interdependencies between these components theoretically and practically. We introduce a flexible BERT-based sequence labeling architecture that a...

papers_with_code.title: 生成,推理与排序:基于多任务架构的数学文字题生成(Generating, Reasoning & Ranking: Multitask Learning Framework for Math Word Problem Generation)
papers_with_code.abstract: “数学文字题是一段能反映数学等式潜在逻辑的叙述性文本。成功的数学问题生成在语言生成和教育领域都具有广阔的应用前景。前人的工作大多需要人工标注的模板或关键词作为输入,且未考虑数学表达式本身的特点。本文提出了一种多任务联合训练的问题文本生成模型。我们设计了三个辅助任务,包括数字间关系抽取、数值排序和片段替换预测。他们与生成目标联合训练,用以监督解码器的学习,增强模型对运算逻辑和问题条件的感知能力。实验证明所提方法能有效提升生成的数学文字题的质量。”

papers_with_code.title: DeepBlues@LT-EDI-ACL2022: Depression level detection modelling through domain specific BERT and short text Depression classifiers
papers_with_code.abstract: We discuss a variety of approaches to build a robust Depression level detection model from longer social media posts (i.e., Reddit Depression forum posts) using a mental health text pre-trained BERT model. Further, we report our experimental results based on a strategy to select excerpts from long t...

However, it is still unclear that what are the limitations of these neural parsers, and whether these ...

papers_with_code.title: Efficient Dialogue Complementary Policy Learning via Deep Q-network Policy and Episodic Memory Policy
papers_with_code.abstract: Deep reinforcement learning has shown great potential in training dialogue policies. However, its favorable performance comes at the cost of many rounds of interaction. Most of the existing dialogue policy methods rely on a single learning system, while the human brain has two specialized learning a...

papers_with_code.abstract: Recent advances in natural language processing make embedding representations dominate the computing language world. papers_with_code.abstract: Automatic speech recognition is a tool used to transform human speech into a written form. papers_with_code.abstract: This paper examines the state of data protection and privacy in the United States. papers_with_code.abstract: Any test that promises to assess Human Knowledge of Language (KoL) for any statistically-based Language Model (LM) must meet three requirements: (1) comprehensive coverage of linguistic phenomena; (2) replicable and statistically-vetted human judgement data; and (3) test the LM’s ability to track th...

papers_with_code.abstract: The generation of referring expressions (REs) is a non-deterministic task. However, the algorithms for the generation of REs are standardly evaluated against corpora of written texts which include only one RE per each reference. Our goal in this work is firstly to reproduce one of the few studies ta...

papers_with_code.abstract: Visual Question Answering (VQA) is a challenge problem that can advance AI by integrating several important sub-disciplines including natural language understanding and computer vision. Large VQA datasets that are publicly available for training and evaluation have driven the growth of VQA models th...

papers_with_code.title: Iterative Feature Mining for Constraint-Based Data Collection to Increase Data Diversity and Model Robustness
papers_with_code.abstract: Diverse data is crucial for training robust models, but crowdsourced text often lacks diversity as workers tend to write simple variations from prompts. We propose a general approach for guiding workers to write more diverse text by iteratively constraining their writing. We show how prior workflows...

twitter.title: Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models
twitter.authors: Kaplan, J., McCandlish, S., Henighan, T., Brown, T.B., Chess, B., Child, R., Gray, S., Radford, A., Wu, J., Amodei, D.
twitter.abstract: Empirical scaling laws for language model performance have been crucial for the development of large language models. This paper presents a comprehensive analysis of neural language model performance as a function of model size, dataset size, and compute budget.

twitter.title: Constitutional AI: A Framework for Machine Learning Systems
twitter.authors: Askell, A., Brundage, M., Hadfield, G.
twitter.abstract: This paper introduces a framework for developing AI systems with built-in constraints and values, ensuring they behave in alignment with human preferences and ethical principles.

twitter.title: The Science of Training Large Language Models
twitter.authors: Sutskever, I., Amodei, D., Hernandez, D.
twitter.abstract: A comprehensive review of the techniques and challenges in training large language models, including optimization strategies, architectural considerations, and computational requirements.

twitter.title: Multimodal Learning with Vision-Language Models
twitter.authors: Johnson, M., Li, K., Zhang, P.
twitter.abstract: An exploration of how vision-language models can effectively learn from multiple modalities, combining visual and textual information for improved understanding and generation capabilities.

twitter.title: Efficient Fine-tuning Strategies for Large Language Models
twitter.authors: Wang, R., Smith, A., Chen, T.
twitter.abstract: This study presents novel approaches to fine-tuning large language models with minimal computational resources while maintaining performance across various tasks.

twitter.title: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback: A Comprehensive Survey
twitter.authors: Miller, E., Davis, R., Wilson, J.
twitter.abstract: A detailed survey of current approaches to reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF), including methodologies, challenges, and future directions.

twitter.title: Transformer Architecture Improvements for Vision Tasks
twitter.authors: Anderson, K., Brown, L., Taylor, M.
twitter.abstract: Novel modifications to the transformer architecture specifically designed to enhance performance on computer vision tasks while maintaining computational efficiency.

twitter.title: Ethical Considerations in AI Model Deployment
twitter.authors: Thompson, S., Garcia, M., Lee, H.
twitter.abstract: An analysis of ethical challenges and proposed solutions for deploying AI models in production environments, focusing on fairness, accountability, and transparency.

twitter.title: Zero-shot Learning in Multilingual Models
twitter.authors: Kim, J., Patel, R., Müller, A.
twitter.abstract: Investigation of zero-shot capabilities in multilingual language models, with emphasis on cross-lingual transfer and performance across diverse language families.

twitter.title: Attention Mechanisms for Audio Processing
twitter.authors: Roberts, C., White, S., Martinez, E.
twitter.abstract: A novel approach to applying attention mechanisms for audio signal processing, demonstrating improved performance in speech recognition and music generation tasks.
